title: A house inspection outweighs its cost
summary: Buying a new house is a dream come true for most Malaysians.
content:
BUYING a new house is a dream come true for most Malaysians.

That first step through the front door and smelling the fresh paint coating the walls is a feeling like no other. Sunlight shines through the windows, brightening the place up and securing the certitude that this is home.

title: Rethinking the shopping mall experience
summary: In Malaysia, the shopping mall is often synonymous with luxury and comfort – pristine floors, chilly air-conditioning, spotless restrooms and a noticeable security presence. These elements are seen as essential to creating an ideal environment for shoppers.
content:
Malaysian spending their time with family at a mall during the festive and school break.

In Malaysia, the shopping mall is often synonymous with luxury and comfort – pristine floors, chilly air-conditioning, spotless restrooms and a noticeable security presence. These elements are seen as essential to creating an ideal environment for shoppers.

However, this concept of what constitutes an excellent mall

title: Tenants and landlords have mutual responsibilities
summary: What comes with renting out your home to tenants? It can be a rollercoaster ride of emotions. Or like playing a high-stakes game of Russian roulette, but with rent cheques instead of bullets.
content:
What comes with renting out your home to tenants? It can be a rollercoaster ride of emotions. Or like playing a high-stakes game of Russian roulette, but with rent cheques instead of bullets.

One wrong spin and you could end up with a tenant who’s more trouble than his or her worth. But done right, renting out your home can be a lucrative investment.

title: Police probing allegations of indoctrination at GISB quarantine centres in Malaysia and abroad
summary: The police are currently investigating claims made via Pusat Kajian Ajaran Sesat's (Pukas) Facebook account regarding the existence of GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd quarantine centres at various locations, both domestically and abroad.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 28): The police are currently investigating claims made via Pusat Kajian Ajaran Sesat's (Pukas) Facebook account regarding the existence of GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd quarantine centres at various locations, both domestically and abroad.

In a media statement on Saturday, Inspector General of Police (IGP) Tan Sri Razarudin Husain said the quarantine centres are believed to be used for indoctrination, and to subject problematic members to mental abuse.

title: BN retains Mahkota state seat with landslide majority of 20,648 votes
summary: Barisan Nasional (BN) retained the Mahkota state seat after its candidate Syed Hussien Syed Abdullah secured a 20,648-vote majority win over the Perikatan Nasional (PN) challenger in the by-election on Saturday.
content:
KLUANG (Sept 28): Barisan Nasional (BN) retained the Mahkota state seat after its candidate Syed Hussien Syed Abdullah secured a 20,648-vote majority win over the Perikatan Nasional (PN) challenger in the by-election on Saturday.

Syed Hussien, the Kluang Umno Youth chief who represented the unity government, garnered 27,995 votes, surpassing PN’s Mohamad Haizan Jaafar, who received 7,347 votes.

The official results were announced by

title: Fahmi welcomes telco-media collaboration to develop AI applications
summary: Malaysia welcomes the collaboration of telecommunications companies (telcos) with any local media organisations to develop artificial intelligence (AI) applications to help produce content, as well as report efficiently and effectively.
content:
BEIJING (Sept 28): Malaysia welcomes the collaboration of telecommunications companies (telcos) with any local media organisations to develop artificial intelligence (AI) applications to help produce content, as well as report efficiently and effectively.

Communications Minister Fahmi Fadzil gave Huawei as an example of a company from China that has sophisticated AI applications that can be used in various fields, including the media and film industries.

"I foun

title: TA Securities expects RM403.7b allocation for Budget 2025
summary: An allocation of RM403.7 billion is expected for Budget 2025, comprising operating expenditure of RM305.7 billion and development expenditure of RM97.9 billion, according to TA Securities Holdings Bhd.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 28): An allocation of RM403.7 billion is expected for Budget 2025, comprising operating expenditure of RM305.7 billion and development expenditure of RM97.9 billion, according to TA Securities Holdings Bhd.

In a report, it said stronger revenue growth versus spending would lead to a lower fiscal deficit of RM76.4 billion, or 3.7% of gross domestic product, in 2025, versus its forecast of 4.2% in 2024, and is on target to achieve the government’s 3.5% target in 2

title: Selangor Zakat Board says GISB, subsidiaries never paid tithe
summary:
The Selangor Zakat Board (LZS) confirmed that it had never received any kind of zakat payment from GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd or its subsidiaries.

LZS head of collection division Mohd Fikri Naim Harun said this is despite the board having held talks on tithe collection at GISBH premises.
content:
SHAH ALAM (Sept 28): The Selangor Zakat Board (LZS) confirmed that it had never received any kind of zakat payment from GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd or its subsidiaries.

LZS head of collection division Mohd Fikri Naim Harun said this is despite the board having held talks on tithe collection at GISBH premises.

"There are more than 20 GISB-related companies on our list, but none have made zakat payments to LZS. We also cannot determine the tithe

title: Penang launches incentives to attract chip design firms, engineers
summary: The Penang government on Saturday launched an incentive programme to attract chip design firms and engineers to the Bayan Lepas Industrial Park and designated surrounding area.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 28): The Penang government on Saturday launched an incentive programme to attract chip design firms and engineers to the Bayan Lepas Industrial Park and designated surrounding area.

The ‘Penang Silicon Design @5km+’ zone will provide annual subsidies worth up to RM2 million over three years, according to a statement from Invest Penang. The incentives will be available to both local and foreign integrated circuit (IC) design firms based in Malaysia.

title: Selangor to build 60,000 affordable Rumah Idaman units by 2027, says Amirudin
summary:
The Selangor government aims to build 60,000 affordable housing units under the Rumah Idaman initiative by 2027, said Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari.

He said the momentum of house construction under the initiative is going well, with 40,000 units currently in the process of awaiting related approval.
content:
CYBERJAYA (Sept 28): The Selangor government aims to build 60,000 affordable housing units under the Rumah Idaman initiative by 2027, said Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari.

He said the momentum of house construction under the initiative is going well, with 40,000 units currently in the process of awaiting related approval.

"We are waiting for the planning permission process and building permission and so on for approximately 40,000 units...10,000 uni

title: Mahkota state by-election results expected as early as 9pm — EC chairman
summary:
The Mahkota state by-election results are expected to be known as early as 9pm on Saturday, said Election Commission (EC) chairman Datuk Seri Ramlan Harun.

He said this estimate is based on the proximity of the polling centres and the smooth voting process, which would allow for quicker results.
content:
KLUANG (Sept 28): The Mahkota state by-election results are expected to be known as early as 9pm on Saturday, said Election Commission (EC) chairman Datuk Seri Ramlan Harun.

He said this estimate is based on the proximity of the polling centres and the smooth voting process, which would allow for quicker results.

“In Kluang, the logistics are quite simple, and everything is close by, with the polling stations also located near the town, so we are expecting

title: GISB premises in Selangor to be closed, assets seized — MB
summary: The Selangor government has taken action by ordering all GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd premises in the state to be closed and confiscate all the company's assets.
content:
CYBERJAYA (Sept 28): The Selangor government has taken action by ordering all GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd premises in the state to be closed and confiscate all the company's assets.

Selangor Menteri Besar Datuk Seri Amirudin Shari said he himself would announce next Wednesday the total number of premises, including shelters and religious schools, related to GISB in the state.

"The shelters that are related to GISB are closed immediately, including religious

title: Ringgit set for further appreciation amid cautious outlook on US economic data
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue appreciating next week, despite traders remaining cautious about key United States economic indicators, said an analyst.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to continue appreciating next week, despite traders remaining cautious about key United States economic indicators, said an analyst.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid told Bernama that several important data points to keep an eye on, including the US ISM index for the manufacturing sector, the Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey (JOLTS), ADP employment changes, and Nonfarm Payroll (NFP) figures.

title: Malaysia and Indonesia renew local currency bilateral swap agreement
summary: JAKARTA: The renewal of the Local Currency Bilateral Swap Agreement (LCBSA) between Malaysia and Indonesia enables the exchange of local currencies between Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM) and Bank Indonesia (BI) with a value amounting to RM24 billion or IDR82 trillion for five years.
content:
Bank Negara Governor Datuk Seri Abdul Rasheed Ghaffour (left) and Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo (right) at the signing of Local Currency Bilateral Swap Agreement (LCBSA) in Jakarta.

JAKARTA: The renewal of the Local Currency Bilateral Swap Agreement (LCBSA) between Malaysia and Indonesia enables the exchange of local currencies between Bank Negara Malaysia (BNM) and Bank Indonesia (BI) with a value amounting to RM24 billion or IDR82 trillion for five

title: China conducts South China Sea exercises on same day as US and allies
summary: China will conduct military training exercises in contested waters of the South China Sea on Saturday — the same day the US and its allies have drills planned — the People’s Liberation Army Southern Theater Command said on its official WeChat account.
content:
(Sept 28): China will conduct military training exercises in contested waters of the South China Sea on Saturday — the same day the US and its allies have drills planned — the People’s Liberation Army Southern Theater Command said on its official WeChat account.

Naval and air forces will take part in activities including reconnaissance and early warning drills as well as sea and air patrols near Huangyan Island, according to the statement. The island is part of what is more commonly known as Scarbor

title: The Week Ahead: US economic data, Xi’s policy speech in the spotlight
summary: Following the US Federal Reserve’s 50-basis-point (bp) policy rate cut on Sept 18, attention will now turn to the docket of economic data from Uncle Sam this week, which will shed light on the resilience of the world’s largest economy.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on September 30, 2024 - October 6, 2024

Following the US Federal Reserve’s 50-basis-point (bp) policy rate cut on Sept 18, attention will now turn to the docket of economic data from Uncle Sam this week, which will shed light on the resilience of the world’s largest economy.

The most important — the labour market report on non-farm payrolls (NFP) for Se

title: Committee to provide legal view on GISB, states to decide on fatwa, says minister
summary: The Muzakarah Committee of the National Council for Islamic Religious Affairs Malaysia (MKI Fatwa Committee) will only issue legal opinions regarding GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd and not a fatwa, said Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Dr Mohd Na’im Mokhtar.
content:
KOTA BHARU (Sept 27): The Muzakarah Committee of the National Council for Islamic Religious Affairs Malaysia (MKI Fatwa Committee) will only issue legal opinions regarding GISB Holdings Sdn Bhd and not a fatwa, said Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Religious Affairs) Datuk Dr Mohd Na’im Mokhtar.

He said that the fatwa related to GISB would be determined by each state according to their own jurisdiction.

According to Mohd Na’im, the MKI

title: Mahkota state by-election: 20 polling centres open at 8am
summary:
All 20 polling stations involving 109 channels for the Mahkota state by-election opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday.

The voting process involves 61,274 voters. It will end at 6pm, to be followed by the vote tallying process, which will be done at the Tunku Ibrahim Ismail Hall here.
content:
KLUANG (Sept 28): All 20 polling stations involving 109 channels for the Mahkota state by-election opened simultaneously at 8am on Saturday.

The voting process involves 61,274 voters. It will end at 6pm, to be followed by the vote tallying process, which will be done at the Tunku Ibrahim Ismail Hall here.

 The Malaysian Meteorological Department (MetMalaysia) predicts good weather in Kluang in the morning, but thunderstorms are expected in th

title: Engineering the future
summary: In this week’s cover story, we delve into a pressing issue that has long gripped the electrical and electronics (E&E) industry: the shortage of skilled talent.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 28): In this week’s cover story, we delve into a pressing issue that has long gripped the electrical and electronics (E&E) industry: the shortage of skilled talent.

Even as Malaysia positions itself as a hub for high-tech semiconductors and E&E, the competition for qualified professionals has only intensified, with the challenge not just attracting talent but also nurturing local expertise to fill critical roles that drive innovation and growth.

title: Renaming the South China Sea
summary: The issue of renaming the South China Sea has been suggested by various observers to counterbalance China's growing assertiveness in the region.The name "South China Sea" itself is a relic of a colonial era when European navigators charted ...
content:
The issue of renaming the South China Sea has been suggested by various observers to counterbalance China's growing assertiveness in the region.

The name "South China Sea" itself is a relic of a colonial era when European navigators charted the waters based on their limited understanding of the region.

However, renaming it to something like the "Nusantara Sea" or "Southeast Asia Sea" could symbolically challenge China's historical and political narrative of the area, especially with regard to its controversial "

title: Sarawak now Affin Bank's largest shareholder, promises "no interference"
summary: KUCHING: Sarawak state government says it will not interfere in the operations of Affin Bank Bhd after emerging as its largest shareholder.Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Abang Openg said there will be no change in the bank'...
content:
KUCHING: Sarawak state government says it will not interfere in the operations of Affin Bank Bhd after emerging as its largest shareholder.

Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Abang Openg said there will be no change in the bank's name, although the state will suggest one if needed.

"The Sarawak government will not interfere in the bank's management. We will let them manage the bank with no interference from us. Nonetheless, bank will participate in the development that we have in Sarawak.

"There is n

title: Oil falls on the week on firmer supply outlook
summary: Oil prices settled higher on Friday but fell on the week as investors weighed expectations for higher global supply against fresh stimulus from top crude importer China.
content:
Brent crude futures settled up 38 cents, or 0.53%, at US$71.89 per barrel. Front-month US West Texas Intermediate crude futures settled up 51 cents, or 0.75%, at US$68.18.

HOUSTON: Oil prices settled higher on Friday but fell on the week as investors weighed expectations for higher global supply against fresh stimulus from top crude importer China.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: Jobs data to test soft-landing hopes
summary: Investor hopes for a soft landing for the US economy will be put to the test next week, as the government releases closely watched labor market data following a series of disappointing jobs reports.
content:
Hopes for a soft landing in which the Federal Reserve tames inflation without badly hurting growth, have helped drive gains. — Reuters

NEW YORK: Investor hopes for a soft landing for the US economy will be put to the test next week, as the government releases closely watched labor market data following a series of disappointing jobs reports.

Wall Street's benchmark S&P 500 index is up 20% year-to-date

title: Dow closes at record high on small-cap stocks
summary: The blue-chip Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at a record high as a subdued inflation report stoked hopes for more Federal Reserve rate cuts, which also boosted small-cap stocks and enabled Wall Street's three main indices to post weekly gains.
content:
The Dow rose 137.89 points, or 0.33%, to 42,313.00, the S&P 500 lost 7.20 points, or 0.13%, to 5,738.17 and the Nasdaq lost 70.70 points, or 0.39%, to 18,119.59.

title: HeiTech Padu buys 30% stake in Islamic payment gateway owner Souqa Fintech for RM16.17m
summary: HeiTech Padu Bhd (KL:HTPADU) is acquiring a 30% stake in a privately held company, Souqa Fintech Sdn Bhd, for RM16.17 million.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 28): HeiTech Padu Bhd (KL:HTPADU) is acquiring a 30% stake in a privately held company, Souqa Fintech Sdn Bhd, for RM16.17 million.

In a bourse filing, the technology services provider said its wholly-owned subsidiary, Synergy Grid Sdn Bhd, has signed a share subscription agreement to acquire 10.78 million new ordinary shares in Souqa Fintech Sdn Bhd at RM1.50 apiece.

title: Sarawak government raises stake in Affin Bank to 31%
summary: The Sarawak government has raised its stake in Affin Bank Bhd to 31% after concluding a sale purchase agreement with the Armed Forces Fund Board and Boustead Holdings Bhd.
content:
Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Openg.

KUCHING: The Sarawak government has raised its stake in Affin Bank Bhd to 31% after concluding a sale purchase agreement with the Armed Forces Fund Board and Boustead Holdings Bhd.

Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Openg said the investment was a strategic move to create a financial platform with a sound and competent bank to boost Sarawak’s economic potential.

title: Key drivers of job changes
summary: Dissatisfaction with work-life balance is the primary reason why people seek new job opportunities and in Malaysia, they prefer flexible work arrangements and a culture that respects personal time.
content:
DISSATISFACTION with work-life balance is the primary reason why people seek new job opportunities and in Malaysia, they prefer flexible work arrangements and a culture that respects personal time.

A lack of career growth opportunities comes a close second, particularly for younger generations (40%) who prioritise it more than their older counterparts (33%).

title: On the verge of a potential breakout
summary: Despite the lacklustre performance over the week, the Malaysian equity market appears poised for a near-term rally, with favourable conditions aligning to support a bullish market outlook for the FBM KLCI.
content:
DESPITE the lacklustre performance over the week, the Malaysian equity market appears poised for a near-term rally, with favourable conditions aligning to support a bullish market outlook for the FBM KLCI.

title: Linking up golfers
summary: Ten years ago, Deemples founder David Wong faced a dilemma. He wanted to play golf more often, but his friends’ schedules rarely matched up with his. Frustrated by the lack of available partners, he searched online for a digital app that could help him connect with more golfers.
content:
TEN years ago, Deemples founder David Wong faced a dilemma. He wanted to play golf more often, but his friends’ schedules rarely matched up with his. Frustrated by the lack of available partners, he searched online for a digital app that could help him connect with more golfers.

“There were platforms out there like Uber for helping people find drivers, Foodpanda for finding food, Tinder for finding dates, Airbnb for finding re

title: Making parking a cruise
summary: It's an all-too familiar story in Malaysia. Urban centres that are choked with vehicles, traffic jams and lots of time spent driving in search of a parking spot, which in turn contributes to further congestion.
content:
IT’S an all-too familiar story in Malaysia. Urban centres that are choked with vehicles, traffic jams and lots of time spent driving in search of a parking spot, which in turn contributes to further congestion.

It can be quite painful. But not if Times24 Malaysia Sdn Bhd, the country’s largest car park management company, has its way.

title: The ultimate butler
summary: Tony Stark stands overlooking the Pacific Ocean, readying himself for the test of all times ­­­­­­– the high-altitude flight. With a roar, he rockets into the sky, passing through clouds and climbing higher and higher.
content:
TONY Stark stands overlooking the Pacific Ocean, readying himself for the test of all times – the high-altitude flight. With a roar, he rockets into the sky, passing through clouds and climbing higher and higher.

Suddenly, the suit begins to tremble. Ice crystals form on the suit. The Mark II starts losing control, the repulsors flicker.

title: ‘Re-booting’ to reduce e-waste
summary: According to the Global E-waste Monitor Report 2024, a record 62 billion kg of e-waste was generated globally in 2022. Malaysia, with a population of 34 million, generated close to 411 million kg of e-waste in a single year.
content:
ACCORDING to the Global E-waste Monitor Report 2024, a record 62 billion kg of e-waste was generated globally in 2022. Malaysia, with a population of 34 million, generated close to 411 million kg of e-waste in a single year.

To make matters worse, recent reports have revealed the presence of illegal e-waste factories in states such as Selangor and Johor, which host two of the world’s busiest container ports. These factories ar

title: Raising the bar for entertaining at home
summary: Evolving preferences and needs among modern homeowners have significantly transformed interior design. The Covid-19 pandemic has no doubt played a crucial role in this shift, leading to a growing prevalence for work-from-home spaces and recreational areas within the abode.
content:
Designstudio MVH’s Van Ham (left) and Capelo. The former has incorporated Cosentino surfaces in several notable projects. — Photos: Cosentino

EVOLVING preferences and needs among modern homeowners have significantly transformed interior design. The Covid-19 pandemic has no doubt played a crucial role in this shift, leading to a growing prevalence for work-from-home spaces and recreational areas within the abode

summary: Tan Sri Tony Fernandes, the chief executive officer of Capital A Bhd, uses an aviation metaphor to describe the company’s journey: “We’re off the aerobridge and taxiing towards the runway.”
content:
Fernandes: Our aviation business is now on the cusp of creating one of the greatest airline groups in the history of aviation.

title: Road to a circular economy
summary: At the BMW Group’s Recycling and Dismantling Centre (RDC) in Munich, a forklift transports a vehicle into a facility where it will be stripped down and recycled. Established in 1994, the facility has transformed over the past three decades into a true centre of excellence for vehicle recycling.
content:
BMW Group’s Recycling and Dismantling Centre has been in operation for thirty years. — BMW Group

title: Uniform global rules needed in war against scams
summary: The case of the sperm scam, in which a man was fleeced of RM25,000, brings to mind the saying that a sucker is born every minute. It is greed that fuels scams, and despite wide media coverage and social media platforms, it is impossible to combat it when people are susceptible.
content:
THE case of the sperm scam, in which a man was fleeced of RM25,000, brings to mind the saying that a sucker is born every minute. It is greed that fuels scams, and despite wide media coverage and social media platforms, it is impossible to combat it when people are susceptible.

Governments around the world could establish global norms and improve information sharing to limit scams. These scams have become borderless thanks to

title: Long-term opportunity?
summary: The decline in deal-making activity across Asia-Pacific, as highlighted by GlobalData, reflects broader global economic challenges.
content:
THE decline in deal-making activity across Asia-Pacific, as highlighted by GlobalData, reflects broader global economic challenges.

The 8.1% year-on-year drop in deals from January to August 2024 may seem concerning, yet the region appears relatively resilient compared with other regions such as North America and Europe, which saw even sharper declines in deal volumes.

title: Key tax measures to boost revenue
summary: Budget 2025 will likely be both business and people-friendly, but there will be some measures to ensure Malaysia’s path towards fiscal sustainability.
content:
BUDGET 2025 will likely be both business and people-friendly, but there will be some measures to ensure Malaysia’s path towards fiscal sustainability.

These measures may require time for implementation as Malaysia tries to improve the low tax revenue to gross domestic product ratio of just over 12% to at least 15%, and even higher in the longer term.

title: Capital A, AAX overhaul is looking up
summary: Getting Bursa Malaysia to approve Capital A Bhd’s restructuring plan is a huge relief for its head honcho, Tan Sri Tony Fernandes, and his team after going back and forth with the regulator for two years.
content:
AirAsia staff at an event. The firm’s consolidation exercise might be further sweetened for AAX by the strengthening of the ringgit over the past few months.

GETTING Bursa Malaysia to approve Capital A Bhd

title: Defusing the PTPTN time bomb
summary: The National Higher Education Fund Corp (PTPTN) provides cheap student loans to help the poor get through tertiary education. But it is also a ticking time bomb hidden in plain sight.
content:
THE National Higher Education Fund Corp (PTPTN) provides cheap student loans to help the poor get through tertiary education. But it is also a ticking time bomb hidden in plain sight.

Unpaid loans are rising every year, and the lack of a solid revenue-generating model keeps PTPTN reliant on government grants.
